action.action-desc: Mr. Vitter introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works

form.official-title: To amend the Migratory Bird Treaty Act to authorize hunting under certain circumstances.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Migratory Bird Treaty Amendment Act of 2015.
Section 3 of the Migratory Bird Treaty Act (16 U.S.C. 704) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of this Act, subsection (b) shall not apply to an agricultural producer, or a hunter with the permission of the agricultural producer, if—

paragraph.text: the manipulation occurs on land of the agricultural producer on which a crop during the current or immediately preceding crop year was not harvestable due to a natural disaster, as determined by the Secretary of Agriculture; and
a local representative of the Secretary of Agriculture confirms that—

subparagraph.text: the crop has been destroyed; and
it would not be economically practicable to harvest the crop.
